intro: Stachys sericantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hedge-nettle, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and culinary uses. The plant features slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs and has small, opposite leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are clustered in whorls and are typically pink to purple in color, attracting various pollinators. Stachys sericantha is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments.
